ARABIC: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Have the kuffar been rewarded for what they did?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Will not the infidels pay for what they had done?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Have the unbelievers been duly rewarded for their deeds?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Will not the disbelievers then be duly recompensed for their laughing at the believers?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Did not the disbelievers get repaid for what they used to do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Are not the disbelievers paid for what they used to do
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely the disbelievers are rewarded as they did.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Have the unbelievers been rewarded what they were doing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Are not the disbelievers paid for what they used to do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have those who deny the truth [not] been paid back for their deeds?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The infidels have indeed been rewarded for that which they had been doing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Have the faithless been requited for what they used to do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Will not the Unbelievers have been paid back for what they did?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Are not the disbelievers paid (fully) for what they used to do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Have the unbelievers been rewarded for what they did?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Have the unbelievers been repaid for what they used to do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [83:36] Have the disbelievers been requited for what they used to do? Yes, indeed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Are not the disbelievers paid) rewarded in the Hereafter (for what they used to do) except for what they 741 used to do and say in the life of the world?' And of the surah in which the Sundering is mentioned which is all Meccan, and consists of 23 verses, 109 words and 730 letters: Surah 84: The Sundering (al-Inshiqaq) And of the surah in which the Sundering is mentioned which is all Meccan, and consists of 23 verses, 109 words and 730 letters:
